newsitem.title: NORWAY: Oslo bourse sentiment flat, shares track sideways.
newsitem.headline: Oslo bourse sentiment flat, shares track sideways.

text.p: Norwegian share prices were essentially flat on Thursday in moderate activity. Dealers said a lack of foreign investors and a wait-and-see sentiment ahead of a new national budget in October were expected to keep a lid on trade.
The Total share index rose 0.35 percent to 839.25 points in turnover of 511 million crowns.
"The market is flat. Overseas players have pulled out of the Norwegian market and that's why we've been flat for the past few weeks," said one broker.
Industrial giant Norsk Hydro ticked upwards 0.50 crowns to 302 crowns in business worth 43.7 million crowns.
Norway's largest bank Den norske Bank retreated 0.20 crowns to 20.60 crowns in 40.5 million crowns of trade.
Seismic and offshore services company Petroleum Geo-Services recovered from Wednesday's steep fall to close 8.50 crowns higher at 169.50 crowns.
